channel.title: My run gets an error!
channel.description: After a while, I run the server and it runs fine. This just started a few days ago where I would have like 8-20 players online, and it will shut off after an hour. :S Here's a picture of it. [img]http://i46.tinypic.com/4t9fkg.png[/img]

item.title: My run gets an error!
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:6, topic:458841”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=561750.msg4099273#msg4099273 date=1347239713]
Your server is packed with memory leaks… You need to eliminate them.
There’s also a bug in PI that allows a player to spawn java’s maximum 32-bit integer onto the ground which causes the server to basically say ‘fuck this’ and run the server out of available memory.
[/quote]Yea. The drop Glitch where you drop a max stack of something. Isnt that where you declare Max.Integer?[/quote]

In your DropItem packet, declare ‘if amount equals integer.max_value, amount equals 1.’

Read full topic

item.title: My run gets an error!
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:5, topic:458841”]Your server is packed with memory leaks… You need to eliminate them.
There’s also a bug in PI that allows a player to spawn java’s maximum 32-bit integer onto the ground which causes the server to basically say ‘fuck this’ and run the server out of available memory.[/quote]Yea. The drop Glitch where you drop a max stack of something. Isnt that where you declare Max.Integer?

Read full topic

item.title: My run gets an error!
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Your server is packed with memory leaks… You need to eliminate them.
There’s also a bug in PI that allows a player to spawn java’s maximum 32-bit integer onto the ground which causes the server to basically say ‘fuck this’ and run the server out of available memory.

Read full topic

item.title: My run gets an error!
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Expedition, post:2, topic:458841”]try jre7? maybe its more stable[/quote]Wow… Just wow…

Means your VPS has eaten through its available memory. Try to add a Garbage Collector and fix any other memory leaks you have.

Read full topic
